reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: WASH emergency interventions for south of Mosul

description.narrative: Due to current clashes between Iraqi forces and ISL in Mosul, thousands of families forced to flee in the direction of closest liberated areas, The Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs reported that a high number of families have fled Mosul area since liberation operation started last November 2016. The statement pointed out that these families were displaced from the east and north of Mosul areas, located all around the city of Mosul. These families are located around Hamam Al Aleel district out of camps , but these districts have inadequate water resources and sanitation that will affects IDPs and host community. Despite the support provided by UN agencies, UNICEF and NGOs, there are many gaps and contingence needs uncovered, This project is in line with the WASH cluster minimum package of support, first line and second line response strategies and activities and overall objectives to provide immediate, urgently required access to safe water, sanitation hygiene to out of camp , affected boys, girls, men and women in order to reduce mortality and morbidity. The project is also designed to ensure the continuity and scale up these services for affected IDPs and host communities. The project also includes critical support to the operation rapid restoration of critical government water projects and the provision of waste management supplies. These will be handed to the local authorities at the end of the project for continued provision of services. Mainly SEDO plan to conduct water trucking for hard to reach areas, presence of mobile teams to supply WASH interventions for new IDPs, waste management represented by garbage removal and procurement one unit of RO, SEDO has direct communications with Mosul local authority and decision makers , they are predict other waves of displacement from west of Mosul in the next few weeks , the estimated number is not less than 20,000 IDPs out of camps in hamam Alil , SEDO plan to scale up WASH interventions in south of Mosul in Hamam Alil , wherever at same time utilize exist IDPs and host community in south of Mosul in Hamam Alil.
